title: ESER's Balsamic Salad Dressing Recipe
description: You can pour this quick and easy balsamic salad dressing over almost type of green salad.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Salad Dressing Recipes ESER's Balsamic Salad Dressing 4.8 (110) 82 Reviews 8 Photos Eser's great balsamic salad dressing. Store leftover dressing in a shakable sealed container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. Submitted by CopperGoat9161 Updated on January 22, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 10 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar 1 tablespoon honey, or more to taste 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard 1 clove garlic, crushed ½ teaspoon dried oregano salt and ground black pepper to taste ⅓ cup olive oil, or more as needed Directions Combine balsamic vinegar, honey, mustard, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper in a food processor. Turn the food processor on; pour olive oil in a steady stream into balsamic vinegar mixture until salad dressing is thick and creamy. I Made It Print 190 home cooks made it! Very nice blend of flavors! 06 of 08 Photo by  ScrapSony 06/01/2017 I used pink Pure Himalayan Ancient Sea Salt, only because I had a jar of that on hand. Very nice blend of flavors! 07 of 08 Photo by  greatlady 04/04/2015 I added some parsley and used regular mustard. name: CopperGoat9161
instructions: Combine balsamic vinegar, honey, mustard, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper in a food processor. Turn the food processor on; pour olive oil in a steady stream into balsamic vinegar mixture until salad dressing is thick and creamy.
